text:
Hello <@U083Z05GQSJ>, could you try adding the `--resetSession` flag to your start command and try again?
```"start": "hs-cms-dev-server . --ssl --resetSession",```
You are my savior. Thank you very much)
Glad that worked. If the issue comes back, please tag me.
So far everything works fine but only with the `--resetSession` flag

Sweet. You shouldn't need to run the dev server with that flag all the time. Now that you have new tokens, could you kill the dev server and run again _without_ the `--resetSession` flag to see if it works?

Also, could you DM me your portalId so we can check the logs to see what might have caused your tokens to get out of sync.
When I remove the `--resetSession` flag, it gives me the Session Token error again.
Hmm :thinking:. Ok, we will do some investigation but glad this flag has unblocked you.

Hi everyone, this week we took the time and we implemented a custom react form component that works with the native form field in the CMS.

It works by taking the form ID, fetching the definition in getServerSide props and then standardizing and rendering the form.

The result is a like for like headless HubSpot form but with fully custom components, validation, tech stack and its absolutely awesome.


I wrote a quick linkedin post about it <https://www.linkedin.com/posts/anze-koprivec_more-proof-on-why-your-company-is-missing-activity-7271933894575226880-PGUY?utm_source=share&utm_medium=member_desktop|here> and we'd also be more than happy to share this with the community in a new boilerplate we're creating that covers all of the basics needed to make the all-in-on React CMS and UI Extension template


We're looking for any developers that would love to contribute to this open-source project and would be happy to jump on board as maintainers.

Anyone thats interested in the form component can definitely reach out in the thread!
<@U083Z05GQSJ> What version of the `@HubSpot/cms-dev-server` and the `@HubSpot/cli` are you using?
